result.execSummary:
The defendant Bethany L. LaFontaine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.
15CM100, Disorderly Conduct-Domestic 947.01(1) was dismissed and read-in to this case for sentencing purposes and costs of the action.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

Costs of the action paid from bond posted in 15CM100.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request
Contact with Aaron Taylor is not allowed until it is allowed/determined by the agent and then only according to conditions set by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bethany L. LaFontaine

Defendant's request to reduce jail sentence with a cover letter from DOC agent-request denied, copy returned
